== Personal life ==
== Personal life ==
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash or Hema Malini while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash or Hema Malini while acting in South Indian films.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue. She had hired a tutor to teach her Tamil not for learning for scenes' dialogues but to interact with people and staff on sets.


In one of the interviews in 2023, Shruti revealed that she was trolled on social media when she just entered the Marathi film industry but this trolling turned into appreciation. While shooting for the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)| Guru Sishyan ]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onesie swimsuit for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onesie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where anyone can get news about South Indian films thanks to social media, OTT and theaters. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onesie swimsuit in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. Right after the first episode of the serial, she was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed for her weight in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation and love for her acting.
In one of the interviews in 2023, Shruti revealed that she was trolled on social media when she just entered the Marathi film industry but this trolling turned into appreciation. While shooting for the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)| Guru Sishyan ]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onesie swimsuit for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onesie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where accesibility to news about South Indian films is easy thanks to social media, OTT platforms and theaters. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onesie swimsuit in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. Right after the first episode of the serial, she was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed for her weight in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation and love for her acting.


She is also a member of a Nashik Dhol pathak (squad) in Pune. Every Ganpati festival, she goes there to participate in the visarjan (immersion) procession religiously. Her photos of her playing the dhol had become famous in 2022 and in 2023 she revealed that due to those photos she bagged a role in the 2024 Telugu-language film ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' thus making her Tollywood debut.
She is also a member of a Nashik Dhol pathak (squad) in Pune. Every Ganpati festival, she goes there to participate in the visarjan (immersion) procession religiously. Her photos of her playing the dhol had become famous in 2022 and in 2023 she revealed that due to those photos she bagged a role in the 2024 Telugu-language film ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' thus making her Tollywood debut.

Sanju Samson

diff

2024-11-16T09:43:59Z
Line 97: Line 97:
}}
}}


'''Sanju Samson''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=Sanju Samson.wav|Àå|s| å|n|d í|u|_|s|√¶|m|s|…ôn}}; born 11 November 1994) is an Indian international [[cricket]]er, who is a member of the [[Limited overs cricket|white-ball]] formats of [[India national cricket team|Indian national team]]. A right-handed [[wicket-keeper-batter]], he captains [[Rajasthan Royals]] in the [[Indian Premier League]] and [[Kerala cricket team|Kerala]] in domestic. Considered one of the best T20 batter in his generation. He was a part of the Indian team which won the [[2024 T20 World Cup]]; however, he did not play any matches. He made his international debut in 2015 in a [[Twenty20|T20]] international against [[Zimbabwe national cricket team|Zimbabwe]]. He is the first Indian wicket keeper to score a century in a T20 international. He is also the first Indian to score two consecutive centuries in T20 Internationals. He is also the first Indian to score three centuries in T20 internationals in a calendar year (2024).
'''Sanju Viswanath Samson''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=Sanju Samson.wav|Àå|s| å|n|d í|u|_|s|√¶|m|s|…ôn}}; born 11 November 1994) is an Indian international [[cricket]]er, who is a member of the [[Limited overs cricket|white-ball]] formats of [[India national cricket team|Indian national team]]. A right-handed [[wicket-keeper-batter]], he captains [[Rajasthan Royals]] in the [[Indian Premier League]] and [[Kerala cricket team|Kerala]] in domestic. Considered one of the best T20 batter in his generation. He was a part of the Indian team which won the [[2024 T20 World Cup]]; however, he did not play any matches. He made his international debut in 2015 in a [[Twenty20|T20]] international against [[Zimbabwe national cricket team|Zimbabwe]]. He is the first Indian wicket keeper to score a century in a T20 international. He is also the first Indian to score two consecutive centuries in T20 Internationals. He is also the first Indian to score three centuries in T20 internationals in a calendar year (2024).


He was the vice-captain of the [[India national under-19 cricket team|Indian U-19 team]] for the [[2014 Under-19 Cricket World Cup]]. He made his [[One Day International]] debut in 2021 against [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lanka]].
He was the vice-captain of the [[India national under-19 cricket team|Indian U-19 team]] for the [[2014 Under-19 Cricket World Cup]]. He made his [[One Day International]] debut in 2021 against [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lanka]].

Sanju Samson

2024-11-16T09:43:08Z
Line 97: Line 97:
}}
}}


'''Sanju Samson''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=Sanju Samson.wav|Àå|s| å|n|d í|u|_|s|√¶|m|s|…ôn}}; born 11 November 1994) is an Indian international [[cricket]]er, who is a member of the [[Limited overs cricket|white-ball]] formats of [[India national cricket team|Indian national team]]. A right-handed [[wicket-keeper-batter]], he captains [[Rajasthan Royals]] in the [[Indian Premier League]] and [[Kerala cricket team|Kerala]] in domestic. Considered one of the best T20 batter in his generation. He was a part of the Indian team which won the [[2024 T20 World Cup]]; however, he did not play any matches. He made his international debut in 2015 in a [[Twenty20|T20]] international against [[Zimbabwe national cricket team|Zimbabwe]]. He is the first Indian wicket keeper to score a century in a T20 international. He is also the first Indian to score two consecutive centuries in T20 Internationals.He is also the first Indian to score three centuries in T20 internationals in a calendar year(2024).
'''Sanju Samson''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=Sanju Samson.wav|Àå|s| å|n|d í|u|_|s|√¶|m|s|…ôn}}; born 11 November 1994) is an Indian international [[cricket]]er, who is a member of the [[Limited overs cricket|white-ball]] formats of [[India national cricket team|Indian national team]]. A right-handed [[wicket-keeper-batter]], he captains [[Rajasthan Royals]] in the [[Indian Premier League]] and [[Kerala cricket team|Kerala]] in domestic. Considered one of the best T20 batter in his generation. He was a part of the Indian team which won the [[2024 T20 World Cup]]; however, he did not play any matches. He made his international debut in 2015 in a [[Twenty20|T20]] international against [[Zimbabwe national cricket team|Zimbabwe]]. He is the first Indian wicket keeper to score a century in a T20 international. He is also the first Indian to score two consecutive centuries in T20 Internationals. He is also the first Indian to score three centuries in T20 internationals in a calendar year (2024).


He was the vice-captain of the [[India national under-19 cricket team|Indian U-19 team]] for the [[2014 Under-19 Cricket World Cup]]. He made his [[One Day International]] debut in 2021 against [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lanka]].
He was the vice-captain of the [[India national under-19 cricket team|Indian U-19 team]] for the [[2014 Under-19 Cricket World Cup]]. He made his [[One Day International]] debut in 2021 against [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lanka]].


Samson started his cricketing career in [[Delhi]] and later moved to [[Kerala]]. After making an impact in junior cricket, he made his first-class debut for Kerala in 2011. He made his Premier League debut in 2013 for Rajasthan Royals and won the [[List of Indian Premier League awards#Emerging Player of the Year|Emerging Player of the Year.]] He scored an unbeaten 212 in the [[2019‚Äì20 Vijay Hazare Trophy]], the sixth time an Indian scored a double-century in [[List A cricket]], which is also the second-fastest double-century in the format. Sanju scored his debut ODI century in the 3rd ODI in the three-match series against [[South Africa national cricket team|South Africa]] on 21 December 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/sa-vs-ind-sanju-samson-first-odi-hundred-paarl-9078173|title=South Africa vs India: When the door was closing on him, Sanju Samson kicks it open with maiden ODI ton in series decider|work=Indian Express|date=21 December 2023 |access-date=21 December 2023|archive-date=21 December 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231221191738/https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/sa-vs-ind-sanju-samson-first-odi-hundred-paarl-9078173/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://m.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/128894/samson-century-lifts-india-to-296|title=Samson century lifts India to 296|work=Cric Buzz|access-date=21 December 2023|archive-date=21 December 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231221191732/https://m.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/128894/samson-century-lifts-india-to-296|url-status=live}}</ref>
Samson started his cricketing career in [[Delhi]] and later moved to [[Kerala]]. After making an impact in junior cricket, he made his first-class debut for Kerala in 2011. He made his Premier League debut in 2013 for Rajasthan Royals and won the [[List of Indian Premier League awards#Emerging Player of the Year|Emerging Player of the Year]]. He scored an unbeaten 212 in the [[2019‚Äì20 Vijay Hazare Trophy]], the sixth time an Indian scored a double-century in [[List A cricket]], which is also the second-fastest double-century in the format. Sanju scored his debut ODI century in the 3rd ODI in the three-match series against [[South Africa national cricket team|South Africa]] on 21 December 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/sa-vs-ind-sanju-samson-first-odi-hundred-paarl-9078173|title=South Africa vs India: When the door was closing on him, Sanju Samson kicks it open with maiden ODI ton in series decider|work=Indian Express|date=21 December 2023 |access-date=21 December 2023|archive-date=21 December 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231221191738/https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/sa-vs-ind-sanju-samson-first-odi-hundred-paarl-9078173/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://m.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/128894/samson-century-lifts-india-to-296|title=Samson century lifts India to 296|work=Cric Buzz|access-date=21 December 2023|archive-date=21 December 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231221191732/https://m.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/128894/samson-century-lifts-india-to-296|url-status=live}}</ref>


==Early life And Education==
==Early life And Education==

Shruti Marathe

diff

2024-11-16T06:41:31Z
Line 31: Line 31:
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash or Hema Malini while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash or Hema Malini while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.


In one of the interviews in 2023, Shruti revealed that she was trolled on social media when she just entered the Marathi film industry but this trolling turned into appreciation. While shooting for the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)| Guru Sishyan ]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onsie swimsuit for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onsie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where anyone can get news about South Indian films thanks to social media, OTT and theaters. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onsie swimsuit in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. Right after the first episode of the serial, she was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed for her weight in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation and love for her acting.
In one of the interviews in 2023, Shruti revealed that she was trolled on social media when she just entered the Marathi film industry but this trolling turned into appreciation. While shooting for the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)| Guru Sishyan ]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onesie swimsuit for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onesie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where anyone can get news about South Indian films thanks to social media, OTT and theaters. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onesie swimsuit in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. Right after the first episode of the serial, she was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed for her weight in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation and love for her acting.

She is also a member of a Nashik Dhol pathak (squad) in Pune. Every Ganpati festival, she goes there to participate in the visarjan (immersion) procession religiously. Her photos of her playing the dhol had become famous in 2022 and in 2023 she revealed that due to those photos she bagged a role in the 2024 Telugu-language film ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' thus making her Tollywood debut.

The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onsie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where anyone can get news about South Indian films thanks to social media, OTT and theaters. Right after the first episode of the serial, she was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed for her weight in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation and love for her acting.

== Personal life ==
== Personal life ==
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash or Hema Malini while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.


In one of the interviews, Marathe revealed that when she did the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onsie for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onsie had gone under the radar. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onsie in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. She was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation for her acting.
In one of the interviews in 2023, Shruti revealed that she was trolled on social media when she just entered the Marathi film industry but this trolling turned into appreciation. While shooting for the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onsie swimsuit for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie swimsuit scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onsie swimsuit had gone under the radar as according to her back then South Indian films didn't make much news outside of those states as compared to today where anyone can get news about South Indian films thanks to social media, OTT and theaters. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onsie swimsuit in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. == Personal life ==
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.

In one of the interviews, Marathe revealed that when she did the Tamil film ''[[Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010, she had worn a onsie for the song "Kathara Kathara" in that film. The film had received negative reviews and did poorly but was mainly remembered for that onsie scene in that song. The fact that she had worked in a Tamil film and worn a onsie had gone under the radar. However when she did her first Marathi daily soap ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 and gained fame in many households, many people out of curiosity started searching about her on the Internet with the first photo showing up of her in a onsie in a pool from one of those still photos of that film. She was heavily trolled on social media for those photos and was even body shamed in the beginning but later on as the serial went on, she began to receive appreciation for her acting.


== Career ==
== Career ==

Shruti Marathe

diff

2024-11-16T03:56:57Z
Line 32: Line 32:


== Career ==
== Career ==
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in known Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006) {{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}. She made a special appearance in a Tamil film ''[[Naanga Romba Busy]]'' in 2020 which was released on television in November that year. In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharmaveer]]'' which was based on the life of a [[Thane]]-based [[Shiv Sena]] leader [[Anand Dighe]]. In the same year she starred as [[Soyrabai]] in the period-drama film ''[[Sarsenapati Hambirrao]]'' which was released on 27th May 2022. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].
She made her film debut with the Marathi film ''[[Sanai Choughade]]'' (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film ''[[Aitraaz]]''.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' (2010).<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called ''[[Radha Hi Bawari]]'' in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in known Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006) {{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}. She made a special appearance in a Tamil film ''[[Naanga Romba Busy]]'' in 2020 which was released on television in November that year. In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharmaveer]]'' which was based on the life of a [[Thane]]-based [[Shiv Sena]] leader [[Anand Dighe]]. In the same year she starred as [[Soyrabai]] in the period-drama film ''[[Sarsenapati Hambirrao]]'' which was released on 27th May 2022. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].


==Filmography==
==Filmography==

Indira Vizha

diff

2024-11-15T11:54:15Z
Line 24: Line 24:
| gross =
| gross =
}}
}}
'''''Indira Vizha''''' is a 2009 Indian [[Tamil-language]] [[romantic thriller]] film directed by [[K. Rajeshwar]], starring [[Srikanth (Tamil actor, born 1979)|Srikanth]], [[Namitha]], and [[Shruti Marathe]], with [[Nassar (actor)|Nassar]], [[Vivek (actor)|Vivek]], [[Ragasya]], [[Radha Ravi]], and [[Y. G. Mahendra]] in supporting roles. The music was composed by newcomer Yatish Mahadev. It began its first schedule on 11 February 2008<ref>[http://www.tamilnaduentertainment.com/tamil.asp?hotclick=indravizha.txt Tamilnadu Entertainment :: Movie Trading Portal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and was released on 10 July 2009.
'''''Indira Vizha''''' is a 2009 Indian [[Tamil-language]] [[romantic thriller]] film directed by [[K. Rajeshwar]], starring [[Srikanth (Tamil actor, born 1979)|Srikanth]], [[Namitha]], and [[Shruti Marathe]] in her Tamil film debut role, with [[Nassar (actor)|Nassar]], [[Vivek (actor)|Vivek]], [[Ragasya]], [[Radha Ravi]], and [[Y. G. Mahendra]] in supporting roles. The music was composed by newcomer Yatish Mahadev. It began its first schedule on 11 February 2008<ref>[http://www.tamilnaduentertainment.com/tamil.asp?hotclick=indravizha.txt Tamilnadu Entertainment :: Movie Trading Portal<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and was released on 10 July 2009.


The movie revolves around [[sexual harassment]] at work. It is loosely based on the [[Hindi language|Hindi]] film ''[[Aitraaz]]'', which itself was based on the Hollywood movie ''[[Disclosure (1994 film)|Disclosure]]''.
The movie revolves around [[sexual harassment]] at work. It is loosely based on the [[Hindi language|Hindi]] film ''[[Aitraaz]]'', which itself was based on the Hollywood movie ''[[Disclosure (1994 film)|Disclosure]]''.

Shruti Marathe

diff

2024-11-15T11:53:13Z
Line 29: Line 29:


== Personal life ==
== Personal life ==
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref>
Shruti married actor Gaurav Ghatnekar in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Shruti Marathe and Gaurav Ghatnekar celebrate their second wedding anniversary |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/marathi/shruti-marathe-and-gaurav-ghatnekar-celebrate-their-second-wedding-anniversary/articleshow/66934155.cms |access-date=28 May 2021 |website=The Times of India |language=en}}</ref> She sometimes goes by the name Shruti Prakash while acting in South Indian films. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref> In 2012, she decided to take a break from acting in Tamil films and decided to act full-time in Marathi industry as she found it difficult to act in those films due to lack of fluency in Tamil language and Marathi being her mother tongue.


== Career ==
== Career ==

Shruti Marathe

diff

2024-11-15T11:19:56Z
Line 32: Line 32:


== Career ==
== Career ==
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharmaveer]]'' which was based on the life of a [[Thane]]-based [[Shiv Sena]] leader [[Anand Dighe]]. In the same year she starred as [[Soyrabai]] in the period-drama film ''[[Sarsenapati Hambirrao]]'' which released on 27th May that year. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in known Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006) {{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}. She made a special appearance in a Tamil film ''[[Naanga Romba Busy]]'' in 2020 which was released on television in November that year. In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharmaveer]]'' which was based on the life of a [[Thane]]-based [[Shiv Sena]] leader [[Anand Dighe]]. In the same year she starred as [[Soyrabai]] in the period-drama film ''[[Sarsenapati Hambirrao]]'' which was released on 27th May 2022. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].


==Filmography==
==Filmography==

Shruti Marathe

2024-11-15T11:15:02Z
Line 32: Line 32:


== Career ==
== Career ==
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharamveer]]'' as a news reporter. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharmaveer]]'' which was based on the life of a [[Thane]]-based [[Shiv Sena]] leader [[Anand Dighe]]. In the same year she starred as [[Soyrabai]] in the period-drama film ''[[Sarsenapati Hambirrao]]'' which released on 27th May that year. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].

==Filmography==

Shruti Marathe

2024-11-15T11:09:08Z
Line 32: Line 32:


== Career ==
== Career ==
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did a Bollywood film ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did two Bollywood films - ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016 and ''[[Wedding Anniversary]]'' in 2017.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2022, she made a cameo appearance in the Marathi film ''[[Dharamveer]]'' as a news reporter. In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].

Shruti Marathe

== Career ==
== Career ==
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did a Bollywood film ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie [[Devara]] where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024.
She made her film debut with the Marathi film [[Sanai Choughade]] (2008). At this point, Shruti was acting in theatre drama as well. Later, on the recommendation of a photographer in Pune, she got her first break in Tamil film industry where she starred in her first film named ''[[Indira Vizha]]'' (2009) which was a remake of a Bollywood film [[Aitraaz]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/did-you-know/Shruti-has-two-different-screen-names/articleshow/45822742.cms |title=Shruti has two different screen names |website=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movies/news/exclusive-shruti-marathe-flies-to-chennai-for-a-film-shoot/articleshow/78142721.cms |title=Exclusive: Shruti Marathe flies to Chennai for a film shoot |website=The Times of India}}</ref> Her second Tamil was ''[[Naan Avanillai 2]]'' (2009),<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317024228/http://www.sify.com/movies/naan-avan-illai-2-review-tamil-pclxwahjdhibc.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 March 2016 |title=Naan Avan Illai-2 |website=Sify}}</ref> and then she starred in the film ''[[Guru Sishyan (2010 film)|Guru Sishyan]]'' in 2010.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-tamil-movie-review-guru-sishyan/20100510.htm |title=Stay away from Guru Sishyan |website=Rediff}}</ref>After making a special appearance in the Tamil film ''[[Aravaan]]'' (2012) she decided to act full time in Marathi film industry where she did her first daily television soap in Marathi called [[Radha Hi Bawari]] in 2012 which then made her a household name and garnered her huge success. She acted in Marathi films like ''[[Rama Madhav]]'' (2014),<ref name="A">{{Cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/screen/rama-madhav-marathi-a-good-attempt/ |title=Rama Madhav (Marathi) / A good attempt |date=15 August 2014}}</ref> ''[[Taptapadi]]'' (2014),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi/movie-reviews/taptapadi/movie-review/32857643.cms|title=Taptapadi Movie Review {3/5}: Critic Review of Taptapadi by Times of India|work=The Times of India}}</ref>''[[Bandh Nylon Che]]'' (2016)<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/FILM-REVIEW-BANDH-NYLON-CHE/articleshow/50761351.cms |title=FILM REVIEW: BANDH NYLON CHE |website=Pune Mirror |access-date=17 October 2020 |archive-date=18 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201018153127/https://punemirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/marathi-reviews/film-review-bandh-nylon-che/articleshow/50761351.cms |url-status=dead }}</ref> and ''[[Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2]]'' (2015). She even did a Bollywood film ''[[Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run]]'' in 2016.<ref name="B">{{Cite web |url=https://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807012854/http://www.sify.com/movies/budhia-singh---born-to-run-review-incredible-tale-honestly-told-review-bollywood-qifmkQeddhdgb.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=7 August 2016 |title=Budhia Singh - Born To Run review: Incredible tale, honestly told |website=Sify}}</ref> Regarding her role in ''Rama Madhav'', a critic stated that "as Parvatibai, Shruti Marathe brings out the perfect pathos as a woman waiting for her dead husband to return from war".<ref name="A"/> In a review of ''Budhia Singh ‚Äì Born to Run'', a critic noted that "But the surprise package is Shruti Marathe as Biranchi's wife Gita. She holds her stead against Manoj with fair gusto. She smoothly conveys the poignant turmoil of a wife and mother".<ref name="B" /> She made her Kannada film debut with ''Aadu Aata Aadu'' in 2017, which was a remake of ''[[Thiruttu Payale]]'' (2006).{{Citation needed|date=October 2024}}In 2024, Shruti made her [[Tollywood]] film debut in the movie ''[[Devara: Part 1]]'' where she acted alongside [[Jr. NTR]], [[Saif Ali Khan]] and [[Janhavi Kapoor]]. The film released on 27th September 2024 and was directed by [[Koratala Siva]].
